title: Priyanka Chopra Jonas locked down in London
description: Speaking as her autobiography is published, the actress talks about lockdown in the UK.

title: 'It was almost impossible' - Ancelotti says Man City will be champions after 17th straight win
description: Manchester City open up a 10-point lead at the top of the Premier League with victory at Everton.

title: Handforth Parish Council Zoom meeting dogged by rows again
description: Thousands tune in for the latest Handforth Parish Council meeting but Jackie Weaver is not present.

title: Trump casino in Atlantic City, New Jersey, demolished
description: The failed business shut its doors in 2014 and was deemed an 'imminent hazard' by city officials.

title: Princess Latifa: What are women's rights in Dubai?
description: The case of Princess Latifa has shocked the world and shone a light on the rights of women in the UAE.

title: Conversations With Friends cast includes Christmas Carol star Joe Alwyn
description: Joe Alwyn, who starred in A Christmas Carol, is among the cast for Conversations With Friends.

title: Marcus Rashford: Man Utd and England forward named in Time magazine's Next 100 list
description: Manchester United and England forward Marcus Rashford is named in Time magazine's Next 100 list as someone who is shaping the future.

title: Time-lapse video shows RAF bomber being dismantled
description: The Victor "gate guardian" was in a poor condition and no collector or museum wanted to take it on.

title: What is a challenge trial and why do we need them?
description: Some volunteers in the UK will be deliberately infected with coronavirus in a "challenge trial".

title: President Biden: Fact-checking his first month in office
description: President Biden has made a series of claims during his first four weeks - are they right?

title: Bridgerton star Regé-Jean Page cast in Dungeons & Dragons movie
description: Regé-Jean Page is to play the lead role in the fantasy film, based on the role-playing game.

title: Covid: Leeds family enjoy stay-at-home 'tropical holiday'
description: The Hodgsons, from Leeds, are on a two-day tropical-themed break in "Hodgeland".

title: Princess Latifa: UN to question UAE about Dubai ruler's daughter
description: The detention of the daughter of Dubai's ruler was also described as "deeply troubling" by the UK.

title: Over-75s 'given time' to pay BBC licence fee
description: The BBC says there will be "no amnesty", but greater flexibility because of the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Brexit: Are freight exports to the EU back to normal?
description: The government says freight volumes to the EU are back to normal. What do the figures show?

title: House prices up 8.5% in 2020 amid tax holiday
description: Prices climbed at their fastest annual rate since October 2014, official figures show.

title: Covid: Seven symptoms should trigger virus test, study says
description: Fatigue, headache, sore throat and diarrhoea are also warning signs of the virus, research suggests.

title: Referee locks heads with Ipswich player
description: Referee Darren Drysdale locks heads with Ipswich midfielder Alan Judge during their goalless League One draw with Northampton.

title: Seyi Omooba: Actress sacked over anti-gay post loses legal fight
description: Seyi Omooba sued a theatre for dismissing her after comments she made about homosexuality surfaced.

title: Covid-19: World's first human trials given green light in UK
description: Healthy, young volunteers are being recruited for the approved study, which will start shortly.

title: England captain Root reassures Moeen over leaving India tour as planned
description: England captain Joe Root speaks to Moeen Ali to reassure the all-rounder there are no issues with him missing the final two Tests against India.

title: Captain Sir Tom Moore: 'Horrific' trolling hidden from Army veteran
description: The 100-year-old's daughter says the criticism would have "broken his heart".

title: Hospital waiting list 'may double to 10m by April'
description: There could be a surge in demand from delayed referrals and delays to treatment, a think tank warns.

title: Singer Glenn Medeiros: 'Sexual favours were the norm in music industry'
description: Former pop star Glenn Medeiros says many fellow performers were pressured into sex to get ahead.

title: 'Why we saw the old Liverpool against RB Leipzig'
description: Liverpool's Champions League win over RB Leipzig was both the ideal result and pretty much the perfect performance, says Stephen Warnock.

title: Blickling Hall: Wasps deployed to protect mansion from moths
description: Pests and moulds are thriving at historic properties in lockdown, the National Trust says.

title: The papers: 'Ready, test, go' and 'roadmap revealed'
description: Wednesday's papers outline the potential route out of lockdown in England as 1.7 million are told to shield.

title: Covid deaths: If the news leaves you numb, you're not alone
description: "Compassion fatigue" is common among NHS staff, but many more of us could be feeling it right now.

title: Covid-19: Losing both parents to coronavirus
description: BBC reporter Cathy Killick shares her experience after both of her parents died within weeks.

title: Covid: How will we know if the vaccine is working?
description: Deaths are falling faster for the over-80s - but does that mean the vaccine is working?

title: Coronavirus: Should university students get a refund?
description: The pandemic has meant most students have been unable to go to lectures - so should they get a refund?

title: Covid: Trials test the efficacy of Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine on children
description: Some 300 volunteers will take part in the first coronavirus vaccination trial on children and young adults.

title: Mars landings that did (and didn't) go to plan
description: With two missions to land on Mars in 2021, Laura Foster looks back at all the previous attempts.

title: ‘People are starting to see light at the end of the tunnel’
description: Doctors in Wales describe the pressure to help patients who’ve suffered delayed treatment during the pandemic.

title: Princess Latifa: Jailed in Dubai by my father
description: Princess Latifa disappeared in 2018, but managed to send secret messages to her friends.

title: 'Spy pixels in emails have become endemic'
description: Email app Hey reveals that two-thirds of the messages it handles contain the hidden trackers.

title: Nodeep Kaur: The jailed activist Meena Harris tweeted about
description: Who is Nodeep Kaur, the young woman whose arrest has caused global outrage?
